name: Quetiapine (Seroquel)
summary: Quetiapine, marketed as Seroquel, is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and as an adjunct for major depressive disorder. It has sedative, mood-stabilizing, and antipsychotic effects.
description: Quetiapine is an atypical antipsychotic that exerts its effects primarily through antagonism at serotonin 5-HT2A and dopamine D2 receptors, with additional action on histamine H1 and adrenergic α1 and α2 receptors. It is available in both immediate-release (IR) and extended-release (XR) formulations. In addition to its FDA-approved uses for schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and adjunctive treatment of major depressive disorder, it is sometimes prescribed off-label for anxiety disorders and insomnia, though caution is advised due to side effects and dependency risk.

contraindications: Use with caution in severe hepatic impairment
monitoring_required: Cataract development (eye exams for long-term use)

items: Schizophrenia in adults and adolescents (13–17 years)
Bipolar disorder (manic and depressive episodes) in adults and children (10–17 years)
Maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder as adjunct to mood stabilizers
Adjunctive therapy for major depressive disorder in adults

sections.text: Quetiapine's antipsychotic and mood-stabilizing effects are attributed to antagonism at serotonin 5-HT2A and dopamine D2 receptors. Additional antagonism at histamine H1 receptors contributes to sedative effects, while α1-adrenergic receptor antagonism accounts for orthostatic hypotension.

adult.Schizophrenia: 300–800 mg/day in divided doses (IR) or once daily (XR)

items: Immediate-release tablets: 25 mg, 50 mg, 100 mg, 200 mg, 300 mg, 400 mg
Extended-release tablets: 50 mg, 150 mg, 200 mg, 300 mg, 400 mg

sections.text: Antipsychotic effects may be observed within 1 week; mood effects within 1–2 weeks; full response may require 4–6 weeks.

other: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis
Suicidality risk in young adults and adolescents

items: Weight and metabolic parameters at baseline and periodically
ECG if cardiac risk factors present

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to adverse effects, especially orthostatic hypotension and sedation

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction over 1–2 weeks recommended to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as insomnia, nausea, and return of psychotic or mood symptoms.

items: XR formulation should be taken on an empty stomach or with a light meal
IR formulation can be taken without regard to meals
High sedative potential makes it suitable for nighttime dosing

seo.title: Quetiapine (Seroquel) - Indications, Dosing, Side Effects, and Safety
seo.description: Comprehensive guide to quetiapine (Seroquel), including uses for schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and depression. Learn about dosing, side effects, and safety.
